content.prompt: Based on the passage and your knowledge of world history, which of the following can be inferred about the economic hierarchy in San Juan Perib√°n?

choices.label: Mulattoes and mestizos had no property rights and worked as tenant farmers on creole-owned plantations.
Creoles were predominantly employed in commerce and administration, whereas mulattoes and mestizos were predominantly employed in agriculture.
Mulatto and mestizo communities had some economic resources, but creoles were still economically dominant.
Creoles were being outcompeted economically by their mulatto and mestizo counterparts and were becoming impoverished as a result.
